page.title: 15Events
page.content: On the last Sunday in June Cliffe Village has its annual Fair and on the first Saturday in July Hemingbrough holds its Annual Fete. The Fete is the largest event in village life. It has been held in each of the last six years and has been blessed with fine weather on each occasion. The 1985 Fete Queen is Diane Livsey who rode around the village in procession led by a Pipe Band followed by seven decorated floats, people in fancy dress and mums pushing decorated prams. Everyone was represented in the Parade, from pre-school playgroup to senior citizens. On the field were stalls, games, competitions, displays and sports. The sports included athletics, cricket and rounders and involved teams from schools at Goole, Howden, Camblesforth and Hemingbrough.
